document_data.caption: A map of Malatra not showing Suranatra.
document_data.name: Suranatra
document_data.mainbody: '''Suranatra''' was the first capital city of the [[Kuong Kingdom]] in [[Malatra]], later deserted and fallen into ruins. It lay among the southern foothills of the [[Akashnu Mountains]].<ref group="note">Like many places in the Kuong Kingdom, Suranatra and the Akashnu Mountains have not been marked on any map, so their location is unknown.
document_data.History:
The ancient city of Suranatra was where the Kuong Kingdom first arose, founded by [[Vishnan I]] with it as his capital. From the outset, it was an aggressive and theocratic empire. Funded by the [[gems]] and precious metals of the Akashnu Mountains, the rich and puissant priest-kings of Suranatra expanded their dominion to the [[Kunong River]] and to the coast.

However, as the Kuong Kingdom expanded, it was forced to relocate its capital to [[Parmahana]] for administrative purposes. The people demolished part of the city, ironically to prevent its temples and holy sites from being desecrated after they left.
document_data.Description: By the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]], the jungle had reclaimed the ruins of Suranatra, though not as much as its successor, Parmahana. Wanderers and criminals used these ruins as a place to hide.
